text: A trio of Acehnese speakers, recorded for Wikitongues. Acehnese has a large vowel inventory, with ten oral monophthong vowels,, citing twelve oral diphthongs,, citing seven nasal monophthong vowels,, citing and five nasal diphthongs., citing ==Vowels== Native-speaking linguists divide vowels in Acehnese into several categories: oral monophthongs, oral diphthongs (which are further divided into the ones ending with /ə/ and with /i/), nasal monophthongs, and nasal diphthongs., citing ===Oral vowels=== Oral monophthong vowels in Acehnese are shown in the table below., citing {|class="wikitable" style=text-align:center |-style="font-size: 90%;" |+ |- ! Close |width=30px style="border-right: 0;"| |width=30px style="border-right: 0;"| |width=30px style="border-right: 0;"| |- ! Close-mid |style="border- right: 0;"| |style="border-right: 0;"| |style="border-right: 0;"| |- ! Open- mid |style="border-right: 0;"| |style="border-right: 0;"| |style="border- right: 0;"| |- ! Open |colspan=1| |style="border-right: 0;"| |colspan=1| |} Oral diphthong vowels ending with /ə/ are shown in the table below., citing {|class="wikitable" style=text-align:center |-style="font-size: 90%;" |+ |- |width=40px style="border-right: 0;"|/iə/ |width=40px style="border-right: 0;"|/ɯə/ |width=40px style="border-right: 0;"|/uə/ |- |style="border-right: 0;"|/ɛə/ |style="border-right: 0;"|/ʌə/ |style="border-right: 0;"|/ɔə/ |} Oral diphthong vowels ending with /i/ are shown in the table below., citing {|class="wikitable" style=text-align:center |-style="font-size: 90%;" |+ |- |width=40px colspan=1| |width=40px style="border-right: 0;"|/ui/ |- |style="border-right: 0;"|/əi/ |style="border-right: 0;"|/oi/ |- |style="border-right: 0;"|/ʌi/ |style="border-right: 0;"|/ɔi/ |- |style="border-right: 0;"|/ai/ |colspan=1| |} ===Nasal vowels=== Nasal monophthong vowels in Acehnese are shown in the table below., citing {|class="wikitable" style=text-align:center |-style="font-size: 90%;" |+ |- ! Close |width=30px style="border-right: 0;"| |width=30px style="border-right: 0;"| |width=30px style="border-right: 0;"| |- ! Open-mid |style="border-right: 0;"| |style="border-right: 0;"|ʌ̃ |style="border-right: 0;"| |- ! Open |colspan=1| |style="border-right: 0;"| |colspan=1| |} ==Consonants== The table below shows the Acehnese consonant phonemes and the range of their realizations. {|class="wikitable" style=text-align:center |-style="font-size: 90%;" |+ ! !colspan=2| Labial !colspan=2| Labiodental !colspan=2| Alveolar !colspan=2| Postalveolar !colspan=2| Palatal !colspan=2| Velar !colspan=2| Glottal |- ! Stop |width=20px style="border-right: 0;"|||style="border-left: 0;"| |width=20px colspan=2| |width=20px style="border-right: 0;"|||style="border-left: 0;"| |width=20px colspan=2| |width=20px style="border-right: 0;"|||style="border-left: 0;"| |width=20px style="border- right: 0;"|||style="border-left: 0;"| |width=20px style="border-right: 0;"|||width=20px style="border-left: 0;"| |- ! Nasal |style="border-right: 0;"| ||width=20px style="border-left: 0;"| |colspan=2| |style="border-right: 0;"| ||width=20px style="border-left: 0;"| |colspan=2| |style="border-right: 0;"| ||width=20px style="border-left: 0;"| |style="border-right: 0;"| ||width=20px style="border-left: 0;"| |colspan=2| |- ! Prenasalized consonant |style="border-right: 0;"| ||width=20px style="border-left: 0;"|mb |colspan=2| |style="border-right: 0;"| ||width=20px style="border-left: 0;"|nd |colspan=2| |style="border-right: 0;"| ||width=20px style="border-left: 0;"|ɲɟ |style="border-right: 0;"| ||width=20px style="border-left: 0;"|ŋɡ |colspan=2| |- ! Trill |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |style="border-right: 0;"| ||style="border- left: 0;"| |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |- ! Fricative |colspan=2| |style="border-right: 0;"|||style="border-left: 0;"| |style="border-right: 0;"|||style="border-left: 0;"| |style="border-right: 0;"|||style="border-left: 0;"| |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |style="border-right: 0;"|||style="border-left: 0;"| |- !rowspan=2| Approximant (Lateral) |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |style="border- right: 0;"| ||style="border-left: 0;"| |style="border-right: 0;"| ||style="border-left: 0;"| |colspan=2| |- |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |style="border-right: 0;"| ||style="border-left: 0;"| |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |} Notes: *Syllable-final k always represents /ʔ/ save in certain recent loans */f/, /z/, and /ʃ/ are borrowed sounds, and are often replaced by /ph/, /dh/, and /ch/ respectively */mb/, /nd/, /ɲɟ/, and /ŋɡ/ are also known as "funny nasals", citing ==Orthography== The orthography of Achenese features 31 letters: the 26 letters of the basic Latin alphabet, è, é, ë, ô, and ö. {|class="wikitable" |+Vowels !Grapheme !Phoneme (IPA) !Open syllable !Closed syllable |- !a |/a/ |ba /ba/ ‘carry’ |bak /baʔ/ ‘at, tree’ |- !e |/ə/ |le /lə/ ‘many’ |let /lət/ ‘pull out’ |- !é |/e/ |baté /bate/ ‘cup, betel tray’ |baték /bateʔ/ ‘batik’ |- !è |/ɛ/ |bè /bɛ/ ‘smell’ |bèk /bɛʔ/ ‘prohibitive "don't" (e.g. bèk neupajôh boh gantang teucrôh lôn 'don't you eat my fries')' |- !ë |/ə/ |huë /huə/ ‘pull’ |huëk /huəʔ/ ‘choke’ |- !eu |/ɯ/ |keu /kɯ/ ‘front’ |keuh /kɯh/ ‘so (e.g. nyan keuh), pronominal affix for second person (e.g. droe-keuh)’ |- !i |/i/ |di /di/ 'in, from' |dit /dit/ 'few, small amount' |- !o |/ɔ/ |yo /jɔ/ ‘afraid’ |yok /jɔʔ/ ‘shake’ |- !ô |/o/ |rô /ro/ ‘spill’ |rôh /roh/ ‘enter’ |- !ö |/ʌ/ |pö /pʌ/ ‘fly’ |pöt /pʌt/ ‘pluck, pick’ |- !u |/u/ |su /su/ ‘sound, voice’ |sut /sut/ ‘remove, detach’ |} Notes: *ë is used only for diphthongs ending with /ə/ ==Notes== ==References== * * * Category:Acehnese language Category:Austronesian phonologies
title: Acehnese phonology
